Change has been successfully merged
What does the subdir "dist" stand for? I'd expect something more like "systemd" or "services"?
I see many other services in dist, I thought that is a convention
Seems to be a precedent set mostly by one particular maintainer but oh well, I'm sure it means something relevant.
We've tended to do this in the bitbake recipes. But it's kind of nice just having it in the local repo.

I did think of why we tend to do this in the bitbake layer. If another system were to come along that had multi-host support, then this would not work as this hard codes an assumption of a single host. That's not an issue with openpower (currently) but I'm not sure we want this precedent set.

Within bitbake we have variables that define the maximum number of chassis and hosts in the system and we dynamically create the systemd target dependencies based on that.

We should define the service file in this repository but the installation of it should happen in the bitbake recipe.

But with that said we've already got a service in here so it's probably best to come back around to this and fix it all together.
Sure..
Where is this service?
The name is wrong, but the service was loaded when I started installed  image, fixing
Done
